msContents.summary: List of individuals paying the syntaximon.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank.

condition.ab: The papyrus is fairly well preserved, but there are numerous lacunae. The surface is broken in places, and the tops of the opening columns have been lost. Two kolleseis visible, one approximately 6.5 cm. from the left edge; the second is located approximately 14.5 cm from the first one. Right half of this sheet miscolouredby dark horizontal lines, whose function is unclear. This document contains cols, XIII (right half) -XV.

handDesc.p: The papyrus is written in a good cursive hand which becomes increasingly smaller toward the end of the document, but which seems to be that of the same scribe throughout. The list has been carefully checked, each entry having at the beginning a short, thick, diagonal stroke obviously added later by a different pen. In addition, some of the entries, especially in col. IX, have a second check placed over the numeral at the end of the line. In view of this fact and the circumstance that three entries have been bracketed (see note to l. 233), we conclude that for some reason the account was doubly audited for this day (the 12th).

origin.origPlace: Philadelphia, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Phasis, son of Petosiris, son of Lakon
Ammonis, son of Herakles, son of Philon
Pnepheros, son of Peteuchos, son of Pekre()
Peteamounis, son of Peteuchos, son of Plaeto()

provenance.p: Philadelphia, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
